author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Pondicherry Milk Producers’ Union staged a protest with their livestock in front of Embalam Cooperative Milk Producers’ Society on Thursday, demanding the government to provide fodder to the cattle as part of relief measures for the flood-affected.

They demanded the government and Animal Husbandry and Animal Welfare Department to provide 150 kg of fodder or wheat for the beneficiaries affected due to flood.

“The government should also provide Rs. 25,000 for the cattle sheds which were ravaged during the Thane, Nisha and Nilam cyclones,” the association stated.

In a press release, they stated that the government should provide cement-floored cattle sheds in Embalam village. “The cattle and calf feed for calf and milch cow supplied by the Animal Husbandry and Animal Welfare Department have been stopped and we want them to revive it,” the union members said.

They also demanded a permanent veterinary doctor to be appointed at the Embalam Veterinary Hospital.

Pondicherry Milk Producers’ Union officer bearers- T. Gitanathan, A. Perumal, M. Masilamani participated in the protest.
title: Milk producers protest with their livestock
